wait.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: to stay somewhere or not do something until something else happens, someone arrives etc
wait.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: Can you wait for five minutes?
I’m sorry to have kept you waiting.
a queue of people waiting for a bus
She paused, waiting for Myles to say something.
wait for somebody/something to do something
I sat waiting patiently for the wedding to end.
wait for somebody/something to do something
I’ll wait till you come back.
Are you waiting to use the phone?
wait.translation[0].definitions[0].note_: You wait for something or someone
I waited for the next bus
You wait for someone to do something, or for something to happen
She waited for him to finish speaking
She waited him to finish speaking
wait.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: if you are waiting for something that you expect or hope will happen or arrive, it has not happened or arrived yet
wait.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: ‘Have you heard about the job?’ ‘No, I’m still waiting.’
I’m still waiting for my results.
I’m waiting for him to realize how stupid he’s been.
wait for somebody/something to do something
wait.translation[0].note_box[0].sections: wait two hours/ten minutes etc
William waited an hour for his sister to arrive.
wait long
She did not have to wait long for a train.
wait ages
I had to wait ages for a bus.
patiently
They patiently waited for the rain to stop.
impatiently
He waited impatiently for a reply.
anxiously
All his friends were waiting anxiously for their exam results.
wait expectantly
He took out his camera and waited expectantly.
keep somebody waiting
He kept us waiting for half an hour.
wait with bated breath
She waited with bated breath to see what he would say.
wait in vain
They waited in vain for their son to come home.
wait.translation[0].note_box[1].sections: wait
to stay somewhere or not do something until something else happens, someone arrives etc
I’ll wait here while you call him.
He said he was waiting for a friend.
hang around
to wait in a place not doing anything, especially so that you are wasting time
They kept us hanging around for hours at the hospital.
hold on/hang on
to wait because you are hoping that something will happen
The captain decided it was best to hold on and wait for the other ship to arrive.
We hung on until the very last moment.
can you hold on/hang on?
used when telling someone to wait
Can you hang on a minute? I just want to finish this email.
stand by/be on standby
to wait and be ready to do something if needed – used especially about soldiers, police, medical teams etc
The army are standing by.
Emergency services were on standby after someone called to say there was a bomb in the city centre.
await
to wait for something – used about something that you know will happen or arrive
I will await your reply (=in a formal letter).
In February, nearly 200,000 prisoners were awaiting trial.
The soldiers awaited the order to advance.
wait.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: a period of time in which you wait for something to happen, someone to arrive etc
wait.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: There was an hour wait before the next train departed.
The average wait for an appointment at the clinic was eight weeks.
